Brother Hicks is employed to oversee the working force on the railroad, receiving $1500 per year. He embraced the Sabbath and sent in his resignation, but the president of the road did not accept it, so he has continued to keep the Sabbath and do his work. He has been sent for a number of times to oversee some difficult job on the railroad on the Sabbath, but he did not respond and they 


                                   -19- 

did not discharge him for he is faithful and is esteemed highly.--Ms. 44, 1890, p. 2 (Diary 16, p. 284).
